newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan to increase wheat import target.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan to increase wheat import target.

text.p: Pakistan will increase its wheat import target for fiscal 1996/97 (July-June) to 2.3 million tonnes from 1.8 million tonnes, a government official said on Saturday.
"We are likely to import 0.5 million tonnes more wheat than our initial target of 1.8 million tonnes," an official of the Food and Agriculture Ministry said.
He said the initial target was based on tentative estimates of wheat production in May.
Pakistan has produced 17 million tonnes of wheat in 1996/97 compared to 17.57 million tonnes in 1995/96.
The government had hoped to hold its wheat imports to 1.8 million tonnes, but the lower crop forced it to revise its target, the official said.
Pakistan imported 1.9 million tonnes of wheat from the United States and Australia in 1995/96.
